column4: Hello, I have so many versions of Linux kernels installed in my machine, so while booting the boot program gives ea huge list
i am comfortable with the latest, how can I remove the rest from the list
will there be any issue, if I remove them, i just want to hold the last updated kernal
If you want to remove them from grub (the bootloader) goto /boot/grub/menu.lst   and comment out the older versions
